intro: Sisymbrium arnottianum var. tucumanense, commonly known as Tucuman mustard, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like broccoli and cabbage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. The seeds are small and often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some regions.
